intro: Rhynchosia stenodon, commonly known as the narrow-toothed legume, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and trifoliate leaves with small, pointed leaflets. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its seeds are encased in elongated pods, which contain several small, angular seeds. Rhynchosia stenodon is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often growing in disturbed soils and open habitats.
